A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
It's a sad world when 1992's Encino Man is more beloved by audiences than a Star Wars movie.

Sadly\, that world is the world we now live in\, and we can thank the "Masterminds" Rian Johnson and Kathleen Kennedy for the brilliant hack-job they did of what was once a meticulous\, rich and story-driven saga. 

It's clear that when Hamil said "They only care about the money" he wasn't joking. Like the Executor\, this ship has nosedived into an explosive failure without Lucas on the bridge to guide the narrative. Something tells me that the lukewarm 50% audience score has more to do with Disney's ownership of RT than it does the actual rating of the average viewer.
